title: Homeopathy
cleaned_text: National Library of Medicine's controlled vocabulary thesaurus, [MeSH (Medical Subject Headings)](http://www.nlm.nih.gov/mesh/). Descriptors are arranged in a hierarchical structure, which enables searching at various levels of specificity. A system of therapeutics founded by Samuel Hahnemann (1755-1843), based on the Law of Similars where "like cures like". Diseases are treated by highly diluted substances that cause, in healthy persons, symptoms like those of the disease to be treated. |Descriptor ID Below are MeSH descriptors whose meaning is more general than "Homeopathy". Below are MeSH descriptors whose meaning is more specific than "Homeopathy". This graph shows the total number of publications written about "Homeopathy" by people in this website by year, and whether "Homeopathy" was a major or minor topic of these publications. To see the data from this visualization as text, [click here.] Below are the most recent publications written about "Homeopathy" by people in Profiles. - Eisenberg DM, Cohen MH, Hrbek A, Grayzel J, Van Rompay MI, Cooper RA. Credentialing complementary and alternative medical providers. Ann Intern Med.
